org.xmlcml.euclid
Class IntMatrix

java.lang.Object
  org.xmlcml.euclid.IntMatrix
All Implemented Interfaces:
EuclidConstants
Direct Known Subclasses:
IntSquareMatrix
public class IntMatrix
extends java.lang.Object
implements EuclidConstants

rectangular real number matrix class IntMatrix represents a rectangular m-x-n matrix. The basic matrix algebra for non-square matrices is represented here and this class is also a base for square matrices.

Read the signature of each member function carefully as some MODIFY the object and some CREATE A NEW ONE. Among the reasons for this is that subclassing (e.g to IntSquareMatrix) is easier with one of these forms in certain cases. Note that if you modify an object, then all references to it will refer to the changed object

Author:
(C) P. Murray-Rust, 1996

Constructor Detail

IntMatrix

public IntMatrix()
construct default matrix. cols = rows = 0

IntMatrix

public IntMatrix(int r,
                 int c)
Create matrix with given rows and columns. A rows*cols matrix values set to 0 (rows or cols < 0 defaults to 0)

Parameters:
r - number of rows
c - number of columns

IntMatrix

public IntMatrix(int rows,
                 int cols,
                 int[] array)
          throws EuclidException
Create from 1-D array. Formed by feeding in an existing 1-D array to a rowsXcols matrix THE COLUMN IS THE FASTEST MOVING INDEX, that is the matrix is filled as flmat(0,0), flmat(0,1) ... C-LIKE. COPIES the array

Parameters:
rows -
cols -
array -
Throws:
EuclidException - size of array is not rows*cols

c - columns
f - value to initialize with

                 int hicol)
          throws EuclidException
create from submatrix of another matrix. fails if lowrow > hirow, lowrow < 0, etc COPIES the parts of m

Parameters:
m - the matrix to slice
lowcol - lowest column index
hicol - highest column index
lowrow - lowest row index
hirow - highest row index
Throws:
EuclidException - impossible value of hirow, hicol, lowrow, lowcol

deleteRows

public void deleteRows(int low,
                       int high)
delete 2 or more adjacent rows (inclusive) from matrix and close up. if (high > rows-1 high -> rows-1; or low < 0, low -> 0

high - end row
